about_the_game:
Become a courageous master ranger in the Dancing Pandas: Ranger's Path demo!

This demo offers a sneak peek into a vibrant world filled with unique pandas and laid-back island vibes. Explore at your own pace, open treasure chests, enjoy the humorous dialogue, and lend a paw with a few quests. It's the perfect way to unwind for 30-45 minutes (depending on your pre-island espresso intake!)

Take your first steps on the path to becoming a courageous master ranger. But in this world where the pandas take relaxation seriously, what happens when the one panda who keeps things running smoothly goes missing? Dive into the demo and get a taste of the mystery!

Features

  • The essential tool: In this demo you'll have one of three great ranger tools; the axe! But don't worry - there's plenty of logs for every panda!

  • Quirky characters and dialogue: Enjoy humorous and engaging interactions with unique characters.

  • Hidden treasure: Discover hidden treasures and secrets throughout the game world, including gems that can be used to customize your character.

  • Relaxing gameplay: Experience a peaceful and calming atmosphere with a focus on exploration and discovery.

  • Overcome fears and challenges: Step outside your comfort zone by tackling obstacles and facing your fears.

name: Dancing Pandas: Ranger's Path Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11 (64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4460 / AMD Ryzen 3 1200 or equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 / AMD RX 570 or similar
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11 (64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 or equivalent
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA RTX 3070 Ti or similar

short_description: Calling all animal lovers! Become the ranger for Summery Islands! Find courage by helping other Pandas. Dancing Pandas: a cozy adventure where bravery blooms beyond your comfort zone.
